sentences: Mari teeb tujuti tiidsalt ja jõudsasti tööd, ent tujuti on lõtv ning loid.
Ta tahtis tõusta, ent teda tõugati tagasi.
Räägiti, et kuusikus oligi hunte nähtud, ent kunagi ei kohanud sõbrad neid oma teel.
context: The word 'ent' in Estonian is a conjunction meaning 'but', used to contrast ideas, similar to English 'but', 'however', or 'nevertheless'. It can connect sentences that show opposition. In the example sentence provided, 'Räägiti, et kuusikus oligi hunte nähtud, ent kunagi ei kohanud sõbrad neid oma teel.', it means 'It was said that there were wolves seen in the grove, but friends never met them on their way.' Here, 'ent' introduces a contrast between what was said (wolves were seen) and what actually happened (friends never encountered them).
